title: Opening .ica files in Firefox with Citrix Workspace app
content:
I need to connect to my employers Citrix portal tot start a Citrix session for my daily job. The problem is that when try to login using my credentials nothing happens except for the loading icon of Firefox that keeps "spinning" (see image).

When I do the same in another browser, like Chromium for example, everything works fine.

I already tried the following steps:

- Installing an older version of the Citrix Workspace app - Reinstalling Firefox - Disabling the blocking extensions

I am using the following versions of components:

OS: Linux Mint Vanessa 21 Citrix Workspace app: 24.5.0.76 Firefox: 129.0

Other colleagues report the same issues when using Firefox whether in Windows of Linux.

Any help would be much appreciated?

title: Private Browsing
content:
I use Private Browsing to read a newspaper, not behind a paywall, for the main reason it hides all the adds. But just this last few weeks I keep getting the message "Please allow ads on out site" more and more not a great problem I just refresh the page and like magic gone. I like to open each story in a new tab so when I have read the paper I can have a whole lot of tabs all with just one story so after I read the story I close the tab and still have the paper opened where I left off for quicker navigation in its original tab. I do not have an Ad Blocked running in Private Browsing mode but as you can see the site thinks I am. Is there anything that can prevent this from happening? see attached.

Many thanks.
creator: Dungogvolts

title: A chaque mise a jour de firefox, mes diff√©rents compte mail et par exemple compte sur le site le bon coin me bloque, m'alertent d'un probl√®me de s√©curit√©
content: Pour exemple, lorsque Mozilla installe une mise √† jour automatique, nos diff√©rents comptes, sur Gmail ou le site "Le Bon Coin", se bloquent et m'alertent d'un probl√®me de s√©curit√©. Pour certains comptes cela devient catastrophiques, car nous avons dans la famille, 2 t√©l√©phones qui ne captent pas dans la maison et nous sommes oblig√©s de sortir de notre domicile pour obtenir le code (c'est chouette en hiver lorsqu'il fait froid et qu'il pleut; d√©sol√© d'habiter √† la campagne!!). Ces probl√®mes n'existaient pas deux ou trois ans en arri√®re. Depuis je n'ai trouv√© aucune solution! Je souhaitais surtout √™tre s√ªr que ces probl√®mes √©manaient du petit Renard; 15 ans que j'utilise Mozilla. Ces probl√®mes r√©currents sont probl√©matiques pour toute la famille, puisque mes parents rencontrent exactement les m√™mes probl√®mes. Merci de nous venir en aide. Cordialement.

title: Firefox no longer works with all functions in Ancestry.com
content: I have been using Firefox as my primary browser in Windows and Linux Mint for many years, and I have always found it to work when other browsers would not. Recently (last few months) functions in Ancestry.com stopped working. I thought that the problems were within the Ancestry system, and getting help within Ancestry was very difficult. I finally got a help chat session a short time ago and learned that everything in Ancestry should work using the Chrome browser. Very reluctantly, I loaded the Chrome browser on one of my Windows 11 computers, and suddenly all of the functions within Ancestry worked properly. I sincerely hope that FIrefox will soon resume being fully functional with Ancestry.com.
creator: ccfowlerx
